page.title: 08Hill Farming 1
page.content: Most farmers in this district keep suckling herds as the quality of the land is poor.The size of herds range from about fifteen to thirty cows. The cows are a variety of breeds normally Friesians,Shorthorns and Charolais.The cows calf in Spring.The calves suck their mothers' milk.When they are about nine to twelve months old they are sold. During the Summer months hay has to be made to feed the cows during the Winter.First the long green grass is cut.It is left to dry for about three days before being turned with a hay flash.In another day or so the hay is put into rows to be baled.When it is baled it is stored in a large shed.
